intro: Stisseria ramosa, commonly known as the branched stisseria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its branching structure and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the spring. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Stisseria ramosa is often found in woodland areas and thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
